title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 January 2016 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:29 <sorinello\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:30 <sorinello> has quit  
05:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:10 <woshilapin> has quit  
07:10 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
07:32 <mflorea> has quit  
07:42 <sorinello\_> has quit  
07:44 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
07:44 <sorinello> has quit  
09:06 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <zzeroo> has quit  
09:20 <zzeroo> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <vmassol> good morning  
09:46 <vmassol> could you please check that what I documented is correct at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HLargenumberofusers ?  
09:46 <vmassol> thanks  
09:52 <Slashman> has quit  
09:55 <tmortagne> vmassol: and empty xwiki.users.initialGroups as otheriwse each new user will be added to XWikiAllGroup  
09:56 <tmortagne> deleting XWikiAllGroup is not a good idea  
09:56 <tmortagne> it makes impossible to associate rights to it  
09:56 <vmassol> ok so it needs to be emptied but kept?  
09:57 <tmortagne> it needs to exist for sure if you want to setup rights properly  
09:57 <tmortagne> making this group fully virtual never been completely done  
09:58 <vmassol> better?  
10:02 <tmortagne> don't forget the note on xwiki.users.initialGroups  
10:02 <tmortagne> and it should be ok  
10:03 <vmassol> ok, seems that by default XWikiAllGroup is in that list  
10:05 <tmortagne> yes as otherwise user would not be added to it  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:13 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <mflorea> has quit  
10:17 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <mflorea1> has quit  
10:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:52 <vmassol> quite a lot of pages ;)  
10:54 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <evalica> has quit  
11:38 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <ansuz\_> is now known as <ansuz>  
12:00 <mflorea> has quit  
12:37 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <evalica> has quit  
12:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <mflorea> has quit  
13:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <Trefex> hey guys  
14:35 <Trefex> a user tries to link to a page in a space as follows: [[common steps >> BioCore-Scraper.Deployment - dev.WebHome]]  
14:36 <Trefex> however this creates a link with "WebHome ?" instead of what we expect  
14:36 <Trefex> and advice for us n00bs ? :D  
14:36 <Trefex> any\*  
14:39 <Trefex> I should say we are using Markdown 1.1 syntax :D  
14:41 <tmortagne> URL generator is not optimized to remove the WebHome part as far as I can see so yes it seems expected to me  
14:42 <tmortagne> WebHome is just implicit in a bin/view/Space/ URL but it's the same as bin/view/Space/WebHome  
14:43 <tmortagne> (it would be nicer to do this optimization indeed but it's not done yet)  
14:48 <Trefex> tmortagne: so what would be the right way to link?  
14:49 <msmeria> has quit  
14:50 <tmortagne> Trefex: I don't understand the question, the link with WebHome in it works  
14:50 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <tmortagne> its a perfectly valid URL  
14:55 <Trefex> tmortagne: well it doesn't work  
14:55 <Trefex> tmortagne: I'm talking Markdown syntax  
14:56 <tmortagne> Trefex: what URL do you get and what do you expect ?  
14:56 <Trefex> instead of "common steps" we get "WebHome ?"  
14:56 <Trefex> I get this https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/create/common%3E%3EBioCore-Scraper/Deployment+-+dev/WebHome?parent=BioCore-Scraper.Deployment+-+dev.scrap-core-dev.WebHome  
14:56 <tmortagne> I have no idea what is markdown link syntax but the reference you have in this link looks correct  
14:56 <Trefex> when I expect https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/view/BioCore-Scraper/Deployment+-+dev/  
14:57 <tmortagne> are you sure this is the right syntax for markdown ?  
14:57 <tmortagne> this looks like xwiki/2.x syntax  
14:58 <tmortagne> WebHome itself is not the issue in the URL you get  
14:58 <Trefex> you are correct  
14:58 <tmortagne> https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/view/BioCore-Scraper/Deployment+-+dev/WebHome works well for example  
14:58 <Trefex> but even with [common](BioCore-Scraper.Deployment - dev.WebHome)  
14:58 <Trefex> it doesn't work  
14:58 <Trefex> it just prints the text out  
14:58 <Trefex> it doesn't parse anything  
14:59 <Trefex> if i put [common](BioCore-Scraper.Deployment+-+dev.WebHome) then it will create https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/create/BioCore-Scraper/Deployment%2B-%2Bdev/WebHome?parent=BioCore-Scraper.Deployment+-+dev.scrap-core-dev.WebHome  
14:59 <Trefex> which again points to create a new page  
15:00 <Trefex> is it the spaces?!  
15:00 <tmortagne> seems to me pegdown does not like having white spaces in a reference  
15:00 <tmortagne> maybe you need to escape it or something  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:01 <tmortagne> I don't have much experience with it  
15:02 <tmortagne> is it better with  [common](BioCore-Scraper.Deployment\ -\ dev.WebHome) ?  
15:02 <tmortagne> (trying to escape the white spaces)  
15:03 <tmortagne> https://github.com/sirthias/pegdown/blob/master/src/test/resources/MarkdownTest103/Markdown%20Documentation%20-%20Syntax.md#link does not say anything about white spaces  
15:04 <Trefex> nope  
15:04 <Trefex> tmortagne: damn, maybe i try removing spaces in the space  
15:10 <tmortagne> Trefex: would be great if you could report this issue on jira.xwiki.org so that we reference some issue on pegdown close it with the a workaround if someone find one, etc  
15:19 <Trefex> tmortagne: without spaces in the Space it works  
15:20 <tmortagne> ok so indeed that's pegdown that does not like getting a white space in the middle of a link  
15:20 <tmortagne> not sure if it's a bug or if white spaces are officially forbidden from its point of view  
15:21 <tmortagne> not very nice in XWiki use case where you can have anything in a reference  
15:23 <Trefex> ok, sure, i submit an issue  
15:23 <Trefex> XE-1517  
15:23 <cjd> spaces in spaces :)  
15:28 <Trefex> cjd ok ok  
15:28 <Trefex> tmortagne: thanks for fixing  
15:29 <tmortagne> Trefex: thanks or the issue, will report something on pegdown side  
15:29 <cjd> No, it's a good issue, I just got a kick out of the name  
15:33 <Trefex> tmortagne: i saw the github issue, thanks! it's just the () and [] are inverted  
15:33 <Trefex> just fixed it in jira...  
15:35 <tmortagne> thanks I modified the github issue  
15:40 <flashdel> hi folks, what would be th easiest way to alter an existing page via commandline?  
15:44 <Trefex> tmortagne: with + in the URL it doesn't work either  
15:44 <tmortagne> Trefex: yes but this is XWiki's fault that does not expect it to be a URL  
15:44 <tmortagne> we need to decode it basically  
15:44 <tmortagne> which should not be too hard to fix  
15:44 <tmortagne> I will look at it  
15:44 <Trefex> tmortagne: cool, finally something useful I submitted :D  
15:47 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <tmortagne> Trefex: actually did you try with the wiki link syntax suggested by the guy ?  
15:53 <tmortagne> from what I see in the code we interpret them so it seems to be that's actually the right way to use wiki link and the other syntax is just interpreted to do something but are really more suited for URLs  
15:53 <Trefex> tmortagne: [label](lcsb-sysadmins.Sandbox+Space "Title") this doesn't work  
15:53 <tmortagne> its not the syntax he suggested  
15:53 <tmortagne> "                        BTW, you can use spaces for links but only in wiki links [[wiki link]] which will link to a file named wiki-link.html, but only if you have the WIKILINKS extension enabled.                "  
15:54 <tmortagne> [[lcsb-sysadmins.Sandbox Space]]  
15:54 <tmortagne> not sure about the label  
15:54 <Trefex> i don't know what wikilinks extension is  
15:54 <Trefex> but the double brackets also don't work  
15:55 <tmortagne> when you use [[lcsb-sysadmins.Sandbox Space]] it does not do anything ?  
15:56 <Trefex> tmortagne: it will create a link to https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/create/lcsb-sysadmins/Sandbox+Space?parent=lcsb-sysadmins.Sandbox  
15:57 <tmortagne> ok so it does work  
15:57 <tmortagne> that URL just means the target does not exist  
15:58 <tmortagne> [[BioCore-Scraper.Deployment - dev.WebHome]] should be better if that page exist  
15:58 <tmortagne> and for the label maybe the same way than with other links works too  
16:05 <tmortagne> forget that looks like there is no way to indicate a label actually  
16:06 <tmortagne> so [[BioCore-Scraper.Deployment - dev.WebHome]] works but it does not cover your use case where you want to display "common"  
16:15 <vmassol> commented on the issue  
16:15 <vmassol> this is a known issue  
16:15 <vmassol> see XRENDERING-362  
16:20 <tmortagne> ok so indeed XRENDERING-362 contains everything, Trefex so the right syntax for your use case is [[label|lcsb-sysadmins.Sandbox Space]] but it's not yet supported by XWiki  
16:20 <ClemensR> has quit  
16:22 <tmortagne> not a quickfix...  
16:23 <vmassol> it is supported  
16:23 <vmassol> what's missing is support for params and labels  
16:24 <vmassol> ah maybe that's what you meant by not supported  
16:24 <vmassol> :)  
16:26 <tmortagne> yes that's what I meant  
16:26 <vmassol> k  
16:26 <tmortagne> (since we already talking about [[lcsb-sysadmins.Sandbox Space]] working well)  
16:26 <tmortagne> s/talking/talked/  
16:26 <vmassol> ok, I read quickly your conversation (was catching back)  
16:34 <tmortagne> Trefex: all I can think of right now if to use the page URL  
16:34 <tmortagne> either the complete URL or something like [label](path:/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/view/BioCore-Scraper/Deployment+-+dev/)  
16:35 <tmortagne> or even [label](path:Deployment+-+dev/) from a page in the same space  
16:36 <tmortagne> [label](path\:Deployment+-+dev/)  
16:36 <tmortagne> [label](path: Deployment+-+dev/)  
16:36 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <tmortagne> basically path means "put that directly in the href in html"  
16:43 <woshilapin> has quit  
17:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: is it safe for me to remove org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-statistics-ui from the <xwiki.extension.features> list for XE? I think it's ok but I wish to be sure.  
17:25 <vmassol> does it mean the stats app will get removed when users next upgrade?  
17:25 <vmassol> (I mean proposed to be removed by the DW)  
17:26 <tmortagne> by "XE" you means XE ui-all because ui does not have this kind of feature  
17:26 <tmortagne> ?  
17:26 <vmassol> yes I mean from xwiki-enterprise-distribution/xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all/pom.xml and from ./pom.xml in enterprise  
17:27 <tmortagne> those feature are here to indicate what this extension provide, so you have to remove that since this extension won't contain it anymore  
17:27 <vmassol> ok  
17:28 <tmortagne> the comment is "<!-- Embedded extensions --><!-- Embedded extensions -->", it's not embedded anymore :)  
17:57 <vmassol> has quit  
17:58 <KermitTheFragger> has quit
